cyclone.name: BILL
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles SSW of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the central Texas Gulf Coast, then inland across south-central Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O’Connor / Matagorda Island, TX

weather_observation.warning_coast: Baffin Bay to High Island, Texas (includes Galveston Bay and Houston Ship Channel)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas Gulf Coast from Baffin Bay through Galveston, including the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (40–50 mph) with higher gusts possible at the port beginning Tuesday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible on the upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel, leading to minor coastal flooding.
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 4–8 inches with isolated totals up to 12 inches, producing flash-flood potential around port facilities.
